intro: Galium sherardia, commonly known as lesser bedstraw, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features opposite, slender, hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It blooms from late spring to early summer, producing small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds.
